author: International Bartenders Association
name: Vesper
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Bacardi
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Negroni
directions: Build into old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Rose
directions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Old Fashioned
directions: Place sugar cube in old-fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a Dash of plain water. Muddle until dissolve. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whisky.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Tuxedo
directions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Mojito
directions: Muddle mint sprigs with sugar and lime juice. Add Splash of soda water and fill glass with cracked ice. Pour rum and top with soda water. Serve with straw.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Horse's Neck
directions: Build into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. If required, add Dashes of Angostura bitters.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Planter's Punch
directions: Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add Angostura bitters, “on top”.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Sea Breeze
directions: Build all ingredients in a rock glass filled with ice.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Pisco Sour
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled champagne flute. Dash some Angostura bitters on top.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Long Island Iced Tea
directions: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Serve with straw.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Clover Club
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Angel Face
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Mimosa
directions: Pour orange juice into flute and gently pour Champagne. Stir gently. Note: Buck's Fizz is a very similar cocktail but made of two parts champagne to one part orange juice.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Whiskey Sour
garnish: Half an orange slice and cherry
directions: (Optional: if used shake little harder to foam up the egg white). Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake. Strain into cocktail glass. If served ‘On the rocks’, strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Screwdriver
directions: Build into a highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Cuba Libre
directions: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Manhattan
directions: Stir in mixing glass with ice cubes. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Porto Flip
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into cocktail glass. Sprinkle with fresh ground nutmeg.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Gin Fizz
directions: Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into tumbler. Top with soda water.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Espresso Martini
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Margarita
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into cocktail glass rimmed with salt (note:Fruit Margarita - blend selected fruit with the above recipe).

author: International Bartenders Association
name: French 75
directions: Shake with ice cubes, except for champagne. Strain into a champagne flute. Top up with champagne. Stir gently.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Yellow Bird
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Pina Colada
directions: Blend all the ingredients with ice in a electric blender, pour into a large goblet or Hurricane glass and serve with straws.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Aviation
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. The IBA recipe omits the commonly included crème de violette which gives the drink a distinctive purple color.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Bellini
directions: Pour peach puree into chilled glass and add sparkling wine. Stir gently. Variations: Puccini (fresh mandarin juice), Rossini (fresh strawberry puree), Tintoretto (fresh pomegranate juice)

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Grasshopper
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Tequila Sunrise
directions: Build tequila and orange juice into highball with ice cubes. Add a Splash of grenadine to create sunrise effect. Do not stir.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Daiquiri
directions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Rusty Nail
directions: Build into old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: B-52
directions: Layer ingredients one at a time starting with Kahlúa, followed by Baileys Irish Cream and top with Grand Marnier. Flame the Grand Marnier, serve while the flame is still on, accompanied with a straw on side plate.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Stinger
directions: Stir in mixing glass with ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Golden Dream
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Godmother
directions: Build into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Spritz Veneziano
directions: Build into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Top with a Splash of soda water.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Bramble
directions: Build over crushed ice, in a rock glass. Stir, then pour the blackberry liqueur over the top of the drink in a circular fashion.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Brandy Alexander
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Sprinkle with fresh ground nutmeg. The IBA simply refers to this drink as an 'Alexander'

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Lemon Drop
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: French Martini
directions: Stir in mixing glass with ice cubes. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Black Russian
directions: Build into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently. Note: for White Russian, float fresh cream on the top and stir gently.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Bloody Mary
directions: Stir gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Mai Tai
garnish: Pineapple spear, mint leaves and lime wedge
directions: Shake and strain into highball glass. Serve with straw.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Sex on the Beach
directions: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Monkey Gland
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Derby
directions: Stir in mixing glass with ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Sidecar
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Irish Coffee
directions: Warm the Irish whiskey over a burner. Pour into the glass (for hot drink) hot coffee, and add a Teaspoon of sugar. Float Cream on top.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Sazerac
directions: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Note: The original recipe changed after the American Civil War, rye whiskey substituted cognac as it became hard to obtain.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Americano
directions: Build into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Add a Splash of soda water.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Singapore Sling
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into highball glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: French Connection
directions: Build into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Moscow Mule
directions: Combine the vodka and ginger beer. Add lime juice.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: John Collins
directions: Build into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Add a Dash of Angostura bitters. (Note: Use Old Tom Gin for Tom Collins)

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Kir
directions: Pour Créme de Cassis into glass, top up with white wine. For Kir Royal: Use champagne instead of white wine.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Mint Julep
directions: In a highball glass gently muddle the mint, sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add Bourbon and stir well until the glass is frost.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Tommy's Margarita
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Paradise
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Dirty Martini
directions: Stir in mixing glass with ice cubes. Strain into chilled martini glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Champagne Cocktail
directions: Add Dash of Angostura bitter onto sugar cube and drop it into champagne flute. Add cognac followed by pouring gently chilled champagne.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Mary Pickford
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Hemingway Special
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into a double cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Dark 'n' Stormy
directions: Build into highball glass filled with ice. Add rum first and top it with ginger beer.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Ramos Fizz
directions: Pour all ingredients (except soda) in a mixing glass, dry shake (no ice) for two minutes, add ice and hard shake for another minute. Strain into a highball glass without ice, top with soda.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Russian Spring Punch
directions: Shake the ingredients and pour into highball glass. Top with Sparkling wine.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Godfather
directions: Build into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Cosmopolitan
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into a large cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Dry Martini
directions: Stir in mixing glass with ice cubes. Strain into chilled martini glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Between the Sheets
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Casino
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Caipirinha
directions: Place lime and sugar in old fashion glass and muddle. Fill glass with ice and Cachaca (note:Caipiroska- use Vodka instead of Cachaca).

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Vampiro

ingredients.special: Few slices fresh red hot chili peppers

garnish: Lime wedge and a green or red chili
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into a highball glass, filled with ice.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Kamikaze
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: White Lady
directions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into large cocktail glass.

author: International Bartenders Association
name: Harvey Wallbanger
directions: Build vodka and orange juice into a highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently and float Galliano on top.

author: Teijo
name: Gimlet
directions: Shake with ice.

author: Teijo
name: White Russian
directions: Shake and pour over ice.

author: Teijo
name: Bluebird
garnish: Twist of lemon and a cherry
directions: Stir with crushed ice and strain. Alternatively you could use half Blue Curaçao and half Triple Sec.
